meta.hint:
Some adjectives compare people, animals, places or things.
Comparative adjectives compare two people, animals, places or things. They end in -er.
Example - Andy is taller than his sister. Example - A boy and a girl are standing. The girl comes up to the boy's shoulder.
Superlative adjectives compare more than two people, animals, places, or things. They end in -est.
Example - He is the tallest person in his class.

content.description: She is funniest in the class.
